title: Kevin Clifton admits he's in denial after shock Strictly Come Dancing exit
text:

Kevin Clifton told Strictly Come Dancing fans that he's in denial after he was booted off the show with dance partner Anneka Rice on Sunday night.

The professional dancer, 36, took to the official Strictly Instagram page to share his disappointment following their Charleston routine for Movie Week on Saturday.

But he joked that the pair would perform new routines live from their homes and created a poll so fans could "vote" if they wanted to see it or not.

"I'm in denial that we're out actually, we've been practising all day," Kevin laughed.

While presenter Anneka, 61, joked: "We'll do it in my sitting room on Friday and Kev and Stacey's sitting room on Saturday. You can come along and watch as well."

(Image: Instagram)

Kevin added: "Tune in at the weekend," before a clip of the pair recreating their last dance appeared on the Instagram story.

The pro said he had found it tough going after being paired with the 61-year-old TV legend.

(Image: Instagram)

Before the series started, Kevin had predicted that he might struggle to get Anneka up to the level required to compete in the BBC dance competition.

This proved to be the case as Anneka's Charleston failed to capture the imagination of either the judges or the viewers at home.

(Image: Instagram)

The routine only managed to reap 11 points out of a possible 40 and judge Bruno Tonioli said Anneka had "slaughtered" the Kill Bill themed routine.

Following the announcement that Anneka had lost out to former England goalkeeper David James, with his pro partner Nadiya Bychkova, in the dance-off, Kevin was reportedly overheard saying to his fellow dancers, "I told you so."

(Image: Instagram)

A show insider told The Sun: "Kevin adores Anneka as a person but professionally he knew his chances of making another final were over, especially as she’s struggled with injury and fitness."

The source continued: "All is not lost for Kevin though as he apparently has "a friend for life in Anneka and he loved working with her."

Kevin will not bow out of Strictly completely though as he will now participate in group dances and the pros’ performances.

*Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC1
description: The Strictly star can't accept defeat and jokes he and Anneka Rice will perform live from home
